comment._content: John Louis Clarke (check spelling in title) (aka Cutapuis, 1881-1970) was a Blackfoot carver from Montana, deaf from a case of scarlet fever in childhood (The same fever killed five of his brothers). He was educated at the North Dakota School for the Deaf in Devil's Lake, the Montana School for the Deaf in Boulder, and the St. John's School for the Deaf in Milwaukee. www.deafpeople.com/history/history_info/clarke.html
